The Monzo app is a game-changer for anyone looking to manage their finances with ease and transparency. The app‚Äôs user-friendly interface makes navigating through various features a breeze, even for someone not tech-savvy. I also love the Pots feature, which allows me to set money aside for specific goals without opening separate accounts. Monzo combines innovation, functionality, and excellent service, making it one of the best banking apps out there. Highly recommended!

Security issues - The app, functionality and transaction comms are great. However, there are security holes in the app. Firstly it does not require or direct new users to secure the app with a pin or biometric. Either an an advisory or a mandatory (most bank apps) process, so it can be left totally open. Secondly, if you log out, the set pin and biometric turn off without informing the user when you log back in. In the light of phone snatching incidents this is a major securiy issue.

If you do want to invest then look up Monzo providers and go direct to them interst rates are better and they respond

column10: Tried opening an account online in UK. Was rejected for some reason. Customer support team took 2 weeks to respond, and that too, without any explanation or answer!! During this time, I was able to open accounts with 2 traditional banks in under 30 mins at each place with RMs assigned to me on the same day. So, for all the talk about ease of opening and having a modern banking system, Monzo, for me, failed miserably. I'm going to stick to the old banks with a human face and uninstall this app.

column10: Great in the sence that it is very fast and provides near real time view of any transactions most of the time. In other words if someone adds random phone numbers to their contacts they can get from Monzo a confirmation that the specific user exists. You have to explicitly turn that off and personalized ads .
